programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: We Can Do Anything Merlin, a 15-year-old student, has lost all feeling in his legs after an accident. He wonders blindly through life, never happy, never content. It’s not until he meets a young cancer survivor named Miller that he starts to learn about the beauty in life.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: A Safe Place 17 Albion St. is home to three: Kevin loves bicycles, washing cars, and is annoyingly loveable. Earl steals the house safe to pay his debts to a local gangster, Frank. Teddy wears a mask and when he finally leaves the house he goes missing.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Saving the Tin Man Jaret Reddick, lead singer of Bowling for Soup, co-stars in this family and faith film about the failing health of a High School senior which causes a group of unlikely acquaintances to collide in small-town Texas.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Aandavar Amuthan, a typical engineering unemployed guy who is also a meme creator. He stumbles upon a unique scientific device and that changes his life forever. Award-Winning Indian Short Film.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Headed South For Christmas A heartwarming holiday family film that follows MACKENZIE, an angst-ridden 14 year old girl (Abby Corrigan) whose mother died during childbirth. Mackenzie's only wish for Christmas is to meet her Mother for the first time. Will her wish come true?

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Funke! The story of Funke, a young Nigerian girl, who wants to play football for the country. The story is set in 1996 in Nigeria. A personal story of struggle and inspiration as she tries to convince her family and friends to allow her to achieve her dream.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Blossoms of Faith Twenty-three days before her wedding, Betsy McLean loses her sister to a stroke. The bride-to-be must take a journey of faith before she can walk down the aisle.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Allure Based on true stories, Allure tells the stories of five women in New York, who come from five very different countries. Each one struggles to overcome her personal conflict, set against the Occupy Wall Street movements of 2011.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: The Head Hunter An old forest-dwelling tribal man befriends a young government official and agrees to spend a few days in a nearby city to see civilization, not realizing that it's a ruse to get him out of the way while a highway is built through his beloved forest.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Julien & Claire Shot over ten days in France, Julien & Claire is a lush, music-driven mood piece that examines the romance between a young American dancer and a struggling French musician after their chance encounter on the streets of Paris.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Dearest Jane A troubled girl must overcome her fear of change, love, and acceptance when she is sent to live with her uncle in the isolated countryside of Indiana.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Tapestry of Shadows Reverend Vincent Purejoy and his wife Beverly witness a drive-by shooting that results in a child's death. Vincent decides to start his own neighborhood watch and suddenly finds himself at odds with friends and family.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Your Good Friend A widowed rabbi and a washed-up pornographer team up to form a clergy-approved porn site. An unlikely friendship emerges between these two damaged souls as they document the process in this touching mockumentary about the nature of friendship and love.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: The Adventure of T.P. Man and Flusher 14-year-old filmmaker Griffin Loch raised funds to write, produce and direct his second feature length film focusing on the haunting and tragic epidemic of teen suicide. The talented casts tells a dramatic story of love, laughter and friendship..

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Wine Tasting Wine Tasting presents the damage that high-pressure careers cause in the lives of four men. John, Mateo, Franco, and Ed are good friends and professional wine tasters. They sacrifice considerable sums of money and time in order to pass the sommelier exam.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Blood Empires Blood Empires is about pride, family, redemption, and above all love; struggling people on either side of the law, rise out of pain and misery.

programme.title: Kinonation - Drama
programme.desc: Some Beasts Working in an insular farming community in Appalachia, Sal Damon, a modern-day Thoreau, seeks solace from a past relationship.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A distintive look No matter what season it is and what the weather bulletin says. Once you see the Princess V60, you will be wanting to sail anyways! Comfortable and spacious, is a phenomenal super yacht, designed with care.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A superb and private cruise ship A new adventure begins, departing from Montecarlo towards Cannes. Maurizio brings you on board a marvellous super yacht, the Custom Line 106, a very luxurious and spacious pleasure craft.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Elegance and out of space technology Elegant, spacious and light, the Pershing 8X is an incredible super yacht with an out of space technology. In fact, is equipped with a special feature, the Xenta Joystick. Sailing has never been easier!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Anvera Shipyard Anvera is an Italian shipyard, specialised in high performance motor boats, that are entirely built in carbon fibre. The name chosen for this shipyard has a very special meaning and is from the local dialect… are you curious?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Convertible Riva Each boat built by Riva is unique in its own way. This Riva 76 Bahamas, for ex-ample, has a special feature that makes it perfect for those who want it all. In fact, it converts from an open to a coupè and vice-versa! What else can you wish for?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A Fast Patrol Boat There are boat that are designed for a pleasure trips, but some others have a totally differ-ent use, and that’s the case of the FSD 195. This boat is a Fast Patrol Boat, essential to operate in dramatic or critical situations.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Not the usual trawler Rough sea, a wonderful yacht and two testers! Get ready for the amazing test of the Beneteau Swift Trawler 47. This boat is not what you would normally expect from a trawler, but so much more!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A crazy test Get ready for a crazy test! This Scout Boats 530 LXF has been equipped with 5 Yamaha 425 XTO outboards. This boat is by the American boatyard Scouts Boats and is their flagship model. This brand is famous for its innovations and the technological implants of production.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Genova Boat Show - Best of motor 2019 During the Boat Show in Genova, you can find a higher concentration of engines, the Boat Show has selected for you the most powerful and the best ones. Among them you can find the Mercury Verado 400 R and the Seven Marine 627 SV. Come and take a look!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A nautical jewel To own or drive a Pershing is any power boat lover and nautical enthusiast’s dream. This sporty super yacht is functional and elegant and it belongs to the new “wing” series, designed by Fulvio De Simoni.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Elegant and functional Lights on the Ferretti Yachts 780 presented at the Cannes Yachting Festival 2017. This model is an improvement compared to the already great previous versions. Now, is more elegant and functional and the change touches every area of this modern sporty yacht.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Gulf Craft Shipyard Gulf Craft was founded in 1982 and it has been playing a very important role in the market, particularly in the Asian and European one. Originally, they were building small boats for the local market, but today it’s quite different. Come and take a look, you are going to be impressed. They have created more than 9000 boats since they were founded. Wow!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An exciting mix Cruising in Miami on board the new creation by Airship Ribs, the Airship 330. This safe and solid vessel is a brilliant mix between the American sporty center console and the Anglo-Saxon rubber boat. Perfect for racing or going fast, is a great day cruiser but also could be a be used as a tender.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A sporty temperament Nerea Yachts is based in Fano, where the shipbuilding industry has among the most skilled workers in the world. This shipyard is fairly new, but is guided and founded by Dario Messina, who has acquired great experience working with best Italian shipyards. This brand treats each specimen like is a tailored suit, and the same care is applied to the Nerea 24, which is agile and with a sporty temperament.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: The best of all worlds A super yacht that has all the best characteristics from all worlds? Do you think it doesn’t exist? Well, the Boat Show brings you to Portosole, Sanremo, to test the Princess S65, and you will be proven wrong. In fact, this super yacht looks like a coupe but has a fly, it is modern but also has a classic elegance… Come onboard!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Luxury and speed For sports cars, luxury and speed are of fundamental importance, and the same can be said for the super yacht that you are about to see. Oryx is a new brand from Gulf Craft, and their Oryx 379 is the first example of a new generation of sport cruiser. A big welcome!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A family dinghy Joker Boat’s dinghies are incredible and they have risen the quality of their products even more. This is the Joker Boat Clubman 24 and is a wonderful pleasure dinghy, ideal for families, perfect for a relaxing and pleasant navigation. So, why does it have such a deep V hull? Well, that’s just in case there is a sudden weather change and you need rush back home, safely and quickly. They have thought it all!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Environmentally friendly In Austria, the man’s intervention has been considerate of nature, which has attained its purity. And how has Marian Boats done the same? Well, they have designed the M800, a wonderful electrical boat that won’t contaminate air or water. Its design is sporty and refined, you will feel just like on a quality fast motorboat, except that is electric!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Aristocratic beauty The Z72 is a marvellous super yacht by Zeelander Yacht. It is characterised by a very sinuous profile, which confer an unquestionable class. The big size of this yacht doesn’t affect the harmony of the lines, which define the shape of this aristocratic beauty. Class and sportiness merge harmonically into this wonderful yacht.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A boat from the future The boat that you are about to see is the Di Più 900 F, and has very special lines, almost like it’s from the future! Well, this doesn’t surprise, they have been designed by Roberto Curto, an internationally renown designer who has won several awards. But the design ins’t the only think they took special care of! This boat has many other interesting features…come onboard and discover them!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Dubai international Boat Show 2019 The Dubai International Boat Show, hosts over 800 brands and exhibitors and is the perfect location where to experience and appreciate the best of boating. What is promoted here, is a real marine lifestyle, that includes different sector, from luxury to diving and also water sports. This year show welcomes a large number of VIP and professionals, just take a look at what is on display…

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An incredible pleasure craft It is time to introduce a new wonderful pleasure craft, the Majesty 140. This marvel has three decks and one sundeck; it is surrounded by big windows that offer a magnificent view from any point of the yacht. If you are lucky enough to get onboard one of these yachts, pay attention, because it is so big that you might get lost!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A shipyard in the heart of the Alps The Boat Show brings you to Ohlsdorf, Austria, precisely in the heart of Alps, to have a peek inside the Frauscher Shipyard. Founded back in 1927, nowadays is internationally renowned for the elegance and quality of its motorboats.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Xenta Joystick Today The Boat Show presents you an incredible system! Xenta, is a very famous company that is known all over the world. They created the first prototype of joystick controller that can manage any propeller! Is very easy to use and has a great performance.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A worth heiress Headed towards Ft. Lauderdale, our Maurizio Bulleri is having a lot of fun onboard the Betram 35, heiress of the mythic Bertam 31. The waves aren’t ideal, but this luxurious fisherman is incredibly comfortable! And what about the look? Classic lines dresses a modern and technological boat… what do you think?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: English beauty Our Maurizio is going to test a beautiful boat in the waters of Liguria, precisely in Porto Sole, San Remo. This location was discovered by English tourists and now offers the perfect landscape of a new discovery, the Princess 55. This beautiful boat has the design quality of an Italian boat and the typical English security system.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An undeclared challenge In America, there is an undeclared challenge among the American shipyards; everyone wants to make sure they built the largest center console! So far, Marine Technology is holding the title, with a very special boat, the V-57. The technology and capability of the shipyard makes this boat an excellence. The high quality materials and the great constructions methods, makes them very strong and resistant. Come and take a look.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A new category This Navetta 73 by Absolute has a greater habitability than a boat this size can express! Also the interiors are very curated and charming, the fabrics chosen are amazing and the lines of the furniture are very nice, as all have been softened. VIP cabins are so nice and comfortable, which is something that is not frequently found. This marvel begins a new category of yachts.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A vintage feel Segesta Yachting has made a very special yacht, the Capri 50. This marvel looks like an American fisherman but is fully Italian. With its soft and modern shapes, this is new boat that recalls the past, a look that is impossible to find in nowadays boats. This boat is handmade and no compromises have been made. Designed only for those who can afford a boat that belongs to the highest category.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Luxury and technology Creating better products is as ongoing process, Ferretti is always seeking for more. The Ferretti 670 is surely a very success full offer just as the electronic equipment onboard… have you ever heard of mechatronics?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: ZF Marine for Seven Marine The largest and most powerful outboard engine in the world is built by Seven Marine and for the transmission they turned to ZF Marine… Check out its performance!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Class and beauty Prepare to be amazed by the beauty and class of the Custom line Navetta 42. You will probably get distracted by the its look, but don’t forget that this super yacht is also very safe and comfortable!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Tradition and innovation The Azimut S6 is a beautiful yacht, with the interiors designed by Francesco Guida. Its materials are very innovative and they blend with the classical elements, resulting in perfect combination. But what about the technical qualities? You will not be disappointed! This boat is sporty, luxurious and very technological!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: La vie c’est chic Lights on the incredible Azimut 55 Fly, the most chic in this category, designed by Stefano Righini. The interior and exterior furnishing are by the renowned designer Achille Salvagni, that gifted this yacht of an extra touch.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Absolute Shipyard Absolute is a renown shipyard that is celebrated for the elegance of their boats. They are an independent company, which results in a quick building strategy and a fast innovation process. The experience is passed on, so the boat to come is going to be more innovative than the previous, and so on.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A new masterpiece CRN Latona is an absolutely incredible super yacht that will surprise you. In fact, it is inspired by the Art Nouveau movement and it is created for an owner that wants to amaze.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An important trip The Boat Show brings you in Krossholmen, Sweden, where is located the test centre of Volvo. This is a very important place to any marine designer and we are about to discover the Volvo Penta D8. Stay tuned!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Mad speed Discover the BSK Marine Skipper NC 100S, very different from the previous model. This super rib is more hi-tech but has still kept the sporty look and is safer than ever!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Bigger, nicer and more comfortable Ranieri International has a long history of success and they keep doing incredibly, especially with their Next 370 SH, made for those clients that want a bigger, nicer and more comfortable boat.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A special furnishing Get aboard the Amer 110, a large pleasure boat that is highly customizable! And, if you like Art Nouveau furnishing, Amer is what you are looking for!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Electric charme If you are familiar with electric boats and you want to see something really special and different or if you have never seen one, we have a surprise for you! This is the Ecoline 900 Electric and it’s here to conquer you!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Designed to be admired A shipyard with lots of history behind but with a very fresh look! This is the first of the MV19 model made by Baglietto and it’s one of a kind.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Guidi Company Profile Our Maurizio Bulleri brings you behind the scene of Guidi, a corporation that produced high quality nautical products, components that are fundamental for a safe navigation.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A fascinating thing Launched in 2012, the Absolute 52 Fly, has now been restyled! So easy to pilot, this model will surely continue to be one of the best selling boats from Absolute Yachts.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Italian style Lights on the Ferretti 450 yacht, a long flying bridge with elegant and light interiors. Its strong Italian style is one of the characteristics that makes it so iconic.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Cranchi Evolution Warum eine Yacht mit fliegender Brücke wählen? Und warum gerade die Cranchi E52 F? Bleiben Sie dran, denn alle Ihre Fragen werden in der heutigen Folge beantwortet…

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Lines of design The designer Stefano Righini has characterised this Azimut 60 with slender and aggressive lines, to which he has added stylistic elements typical of the latest Azimut Yachts range.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Flying on water If you want to have fun with a speed boat or an inflatable raft of about six meters, you might want to equip it with the Mercury 115 Pro XS. You will be flying on water…

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: The safest boat in the World Leaving the port of Genoa on board a very special boat, the Ognitempo 300, an Italian rescue boat.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: METSTRADE Show 2018 The Boat Show brings you to Amsterdam, to wander around the pavilions of the METSTRADE Show, the world’s largest trade exhibition of marine equipment, materials and systems.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A fisherman by an important shipyard On board the Dellapasqua DC Seven, a fisherman built by a shipyard that has contributed in re-writing the history of boating.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A common goal Discover this magnificent boat, the Ferretti Yachts 920. It was born from the collaboration between the Ferretti group and the Zuccon International Project.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Universal beauty On board Majesty 100, the new 30 meters built by Gulf Craft, one of the most important builders in the world. This boat has elegant and harmonious lines, the style of universal beauty.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Universal beauty On board Majesty 100, the new 30 meters built by Gulf Craft, one of the most important builders in the world. This boat has elegant and harmonious lines, the style of universal beauty.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A stylish speedboat The AQA 35 is a comfortable speedboat that offers enough space on board without compromising finesse and performance. It allows you to go incredibly fast, safely and in style.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Ecological and versatile Discover with the Boat Show the super Eco 800 Hybrid! This is an ecologic and very versatile boat, by Ecoline Marine. It’s a hybrid boat that may mark the start of a new nautical era!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Priceless perfection Invictus 370 GT, is a luxury open yacht designed by Christian Grande and is an exclusive product, dedicated to those who love perfection and style and do not care about costs.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: On Cloud 9 Cloud 9 is a term used by the Anglo-Saxons to indicate the greatest happiness, something heavenly. Isn’t this enough to make you want to get onboard? Let's sail on Cloud 9!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Super fast ! When Mercury decided to develop their new 4 stroke marine engine, they wanted it to be the fastest and the most coveted, that’s why they created Mercury 400 Racing!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An exciting test in troubled waters! In the troubled waters of the Atlantic Ocean, an exciting sail onboard the Beneteau Barracuda 8 with the World fishing champion Marco Volpi.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A comfortable boat An intense test, a long distance sail on board the Sundeck 550. This boat is the first one ever built by the Italian shipyard Sundeck Yachts and this model is the perfect balance of functionality, navigational skills and flawless aesthetic.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An incredible mega yacht M/Y Atlante is one of the most incredible mega yachts in the world. CRN builds them strictly following the owners requests and this one is different from all the others because it was designed by Nuvolari and Lenard.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: The promise of Absolute Yachts On board the Absolute 64 Fly, a comfortable and equally habitable Flybridge, not only for its size, but also for the height of the ceilings and the refined furnishings. Here comfort is assured.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A tradition of innovation The renowned boat builders Ferretti keeps up its tradition of innovation and this time comes up with an incredible new boat: the Ferretti Yachts 550. With such a compendium of ideas you won’t be missing anything!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A fine choice When you think you are accustomed to the elegance of Riva, a new model comes to blow you away. It’s the case of the beautiful 76 Perseo, with its fine leathers, the lacquered surfaces, the steel and the marble, the furniture reflect the elegance of the brand.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A dream yacht In the waters of Liguria discover the amazing Riva 88 Florida, a dream yacht. You will be struck by its beauty and elegance. On board this marvel one can enjoy a luxurious and comfortable atmosphere while looking at the beautiful panorama.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Impressive features Ranieri has expanded their range with larger sizes such as this model, the Cayman 26 Sport Touring. This incredible boat is available in another versions, one without a cabin and one made for divers.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Your new favourite rubber boat The experience of the SACS shipyard has been transferred to their less luxurious but sporty and very fast models, such as the Sacs Strider 10. It has been equipped with two 300hp Mercury Verado engines… will it be easy to control?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A perfect day The elements for a perfect day? A warm summer weather, a beautiful Italian lake and a motorboat ... or maybe two? Maybe the Invictus 280GT and the 270FX, two internationally successful boats, designed by Christian Grande.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A rush of adrenaline A name that really defines this incredible model, the Adrenalina 9.0, a superboat built by the Italian Boatyard Lomac and designed by Federico Fiorentino. Made for excitement but always paying attention to safety.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A concentration of adrenaline One Ranieri International’s remarkable creations is the Ranieri Cayman 28 Sport Touring, an offshore playground that will take you out on an incredible adventure. Discover everything you need to know about this model with The Boat Show!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A house on the sea Lights on the great Navetta 52, a new model from Absolute. This great yacht allows a safe and comfortable navigation in all sea conditions. Made for living aboard throughout the whole year, is perfectly crafted and beautiful. It is like a house on the sea.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Choosing the right model When you chose to buy a boat or a yacht, is quality and safety are fundamental, but is also important to choose the right model. For example, do you prefer a coupé or an open? If don’t know, you should take a look at the Cranchi E52 S.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Hall of Fame - Norberto Ferretti An exclusive interview with Mr. Norberto Ferretti, founder of the homonymous group, now owned by the Chinese Group Weichai. He has been a power-boating world champion and has a great experience and sensitivity for leisure boats.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Hall of fame - Paolo Vitelli The Boat Show studios welcome a new host for an exclusive interview. He is Mr. Paolo Vitelli, Founder & CEO of Azimut Benetti Group, one of the reference entrepreneurs in the world of yachting.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Hall of fame - Fabio Planamente From The Boat Show studios, our Antonio Vettese interviews Mr. Fabio Planamente, CEO Cantiere del Pardo. This historical shipyard has created some of the most magnificent sailboats, that became timeless icons. Dive with us into the past and… into the future.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A groundbreaking sailboat The Baltic 142 Canova integrates comfort and high technology with a very sophisticated and pure look. It is designed to not be restricted because of its dimensions and to be conducted by a reduced crew. A complex project, upon which much is expected.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Absolute perfection Absolute Yachts is very well known around the world and their vessels are appreciated for their quality and performance, as much as for their interiors. A great example is the one that you are about to see, the Absolute 62 Fly. Take a look inside…

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A test on full speed We have tested the Ranieri International Next 290 SH in the mesmerising waters of Calabria. At first glance, this boat looks like an incredible one, but let’s see what Maurizio Bulleri thinks. A test on full speed, of course!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Appealing lines The Fjord 44 is very innovative with simple and appealing lines. How about the performance? It manoeuvres very well and sails nicely, even in rough waters. The space below the deck is very spacious, very well thought out, with beautiful interiors and many other great qualities! Is ideal for couples or for a family.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Boating in Miami The Boat Show presents you the Nuova Jolly Prince 38 CC, a great rib that or Maurizio has tested for you in Miami. It has a great habitability and can host up to 18 people. This one is equipped with two 300 horsepower Mercury Verado outboards. Take a look at the performance!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Strictly Sail 2016 The Boat Show brings you to Florida for an incredible event, the Miami Strictly Sail! Our Antonio Vettese is about to show you a selection of sailboats that will make wish you were on board one of them. Among these: the Lagoon 52 S, the Italia Yachts 9.98 and the Oceanis 41.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Constant improvement Lights on the Ferretti Yachts 720, the result of years of experience and passion. Ferretti Yachts is a brand that curates every aspect, from the design to the technologies, resulting in an outstanding quality and an ongoing development.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: What lies beneath To support an unsinkable boat such as this Stab 38 by FB Design, what could you possibly equipped it with? But the 550 hp Mercury Diesel 6.7L engine, of course!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Ice Cup 2019. After the great success of the first edition in Santa Margherita Ligure, the Ice Cup is back! The beautify scenery of Liguria will serve as background to this incredible event that will hosts the great Ice Yachts fleet.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A distintive look No matter what season it is and what the weather bulletin says. Once you see the Princess V60, you will be wanting to sail anyways! Comfortable and spacious, is a phenomenal super yacht, designed with care.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A superb and private cruise ship A new adventure begins, departing from Montecarlo towards Cannes. Maurizio brings you on board a marvellous super yacht, the Custom Line 106, a very luxurious and spacious pleasure craft.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Elegance and out of space technology Elegant, spacious and light, the Pershing 8X is an incredible super yacht with an out of space technology. In fact, is equipped with a special feature, the Xenta Joystick. Sailing has never been easier!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Anvera Shipyard Anvera is an Italian shipyard, specialised in high performance motor boats, that are entirely built in carbon fibre. The name chosen for this shipyard has a very special meaning and is from the local dialect… are you curious?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Convertible Riva Each boat built by Riva is unique in its own way. This Riva 76 Bahamas, for ex-ample, has a special feature that makes it perfect for those who want it all. In fact, it converts from an open to a coupè and vice-versa! What else can you wish for?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A Fast Patrol Boat There are boat that are designed for a pleasure trips, but some others have a totally differ-ent use, and that’s the case of the FSD 195. This boat is a Fast Patrol Boat, essential to operate in dramatic or critical situations.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: More than you expect Get ready for a great family vacation on board the Azimut Atlantis 51! On a coupé like this, you won’t have to compromise! It is spacious and perfect for sports but also for a family use.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Not the usual trawler Rough sea, a wonderful yacht and two testers! Get ready for the amazing test of the Beneteau Swift Trawler 47. This boat is not what you would normally expect from a trawler, but so much more!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A crazy test Get ready for a crazy test! This Scout Boats 530 LXF has been equipped with 5 Yamaha 425 XTO outboards. This boat is by the American boatyard Scouts Boats and is their flagship model. This brand is famous for its innovations and the technological implants of production.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Genova Boat Show - Best of motor 2019 During the Boat Show in Genova, you can find a higher concentration of engines, the Boat Show has selected for you the most powerful and the best ones. Among them you can find the Mercury Verado 400 R and the Seven Marine 627 SV. Come and take a look!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A nautical jewel To own or drive a Pershing is any power boat lover and nautical enthusiast’s dream. This sporty super yacht is functional and elegant and it belongs to the new “wing” series, designed by Fulvio De Simoni.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Elegant and functional Lights on the Ferretti Yachts 780 presented at the Cannes Yachting Festival 2017. This model is an improvement compared to the already great previous versions. Now, is more elegant and functional and the change touches every area of this modern sporty yacht.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Gulf Craft Shipyard Gulf Craft was founded in 1982 and it has been playing a very important role in the market, particularly in the Asian and European one. Originally, they were building small boats for the local market, but today it’s quite different. Come and take a look, you are going to be impressed. They have created more than 9000 boats since they were founded. Wow!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An exciting mix Cruising in Miami on board the new creation by Airship Ribs, the Airship 330. This safe and solid vessel is a brilliant mix between the American sporty center console and the Anglo-Saxon rubber boat. Perfect for racing or going fast, is a great day cruiser but also could be a be used as a tender.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A sporty temperament Nerea Yachts is based in Fano, where the shipbuilding industry has among the most skilled workers in the world. This shipyard is fairly new, but is guided and founded by Dario Messina, who has acquired great experience working with best Italian shipyards. This brand treats each specimen like is a tailored suit, and the same care is applied to the Nerea 24, which is agile and with a sporty temperament.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: The best of all worlds A super yacht that has all the best characteristics from all worlds? Do you think it doesn’t exist? Well, the Boat Show brings you to Portosole, Sanremo, to test the Princess S65, and you will be proven wrong. In fact, this super yacht looks like a coupe but has a fly, it is modern but also has a classic elegance… Come onboard!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Luxury and speed For sports cars, luxury and speed are of fundamental importance, and the same can be said for the super yacht that you are about to see. Oryx is a new brand from Gulf Craft, and their Oryx 379 is the first example of a new generation of sport cruiser. A big welcome!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A family dinghy Joker Boat’s dinghies are incredible and they have risen the quality of their products even more. This is the Joker Boat Clubman 24 and is a wonderful pleasure dinghy, ideal for families, perfect for a relaxing and pleasant navigation. So, why does it have such a deep V hull? Well, that’s just in case there is a sudden weather change and you need rush back home, safely and quickly. They have thought it all!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Environmentally friendly In Austria, the man’s intervention has been considerate of nature, which has attained its purity. And how has Marian Boats done the same? Well, they have designed the M800, a wonderful electrical boat that won’t contaminate air or water. Its design is sporty and refined, you will feel just like on a quality fast motorboat, except that is electric!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Environmentally friendly In Austria, the man’s intervention has been considerate of nature, which has attained its purity. And how has Marian Boats done the same? Well, they have designed the M800, a wonderful electrical boat that won’t contaminate air or water. Its design is sporty and refined, you will feel just like on a quality fast motorboat, except that is electric!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Aristocratic beauty The Z72 is a marvellous super yacht by Zeelander Yacht. It is characterised by a very sinuous profile, which confer an unquestionable class. The big size of this yacht doesn’t affect the harmony of the lines, which define the shape of this aristocratic beauty. Class and sportiness merge harmonically into this wonderful yacht.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A boat from the future The boat that you are about to see is the Di Più 900 F, and has very special lines, almost like it’s from the future! Well, this doesn’t surprise, they have been designed by Roberto Curto, an internationally renown designer who has won several awards. But the design ins’t the only think they took special care of! This boat has many other interesting features…come onboard and discover them!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Dubai international Boat Show 2019 The Dubai International Boat Show, hosts over 800 brands and exhibitors and is the perfect location where to experience and appreciate the best of boating. What is promoted here, is a real marine lifestyle, that includes different sector, from luxury to diving and also water sports. This year show welcomes a large number of VIP and professionals, just take a look at what is on display…

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An incredible pleasure craft It is time to introduce a new wonderful pleasure craft, the Majesty 140. This marvel has three decks and one sundeck; it is surrounded by big windows that offer a magnificent view from any point of the yacht. If you are lucky enough to get onboard one of these yachts, pay attention, because it is so big that you might get lost!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A shipyard in the heart of the Alps The Boat Show brings you to Ohlsdorf, Austria, precisely in the heart of Alps, to have a peek inside the Frauscher Shipyard. Founded back in 1927, nowadays is internationally renowned for the elegance and quality of its motorboats.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Xenta Joystick Today The Boat Show presents you an incredible system! Xenta, is a very famous company that is known all over the world. They created the first prototype of joystick controller that can manage any propeller! Is very easy to use and has a great performance.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A worth heiress Headed towards Ft. Lauderdale, our Maurizio Bulleri is having a lot of fun onboard the Betram 35, heiress of the mythic Bertam 31. The waves aren’t ideal, but this luxurious fisherman is incredibly comfortable! And what about the look? Classic lines dresses a modern and technological boat… what do you think?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: English beauty Our Maurizio is going to test a beautiful boat in the waters of Liguria, precisely in Porto Sole, San Remo. This location was discovered by English tourists and now offers the perfect landscape of a new discovery, the Princess 55. This beautiful boat has the design quality of an Italian boat and the typical English security system.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: An undeclared challenge In America, there is an undeclared challenge among the American shipyards; everyone wants to make sure they built the largest center console! So far, Marine Technology is holding the title, with a very special boat, the V-57. The technology and capability of the shipyard makes this boat an excellence. The high quality materials and the great constructions methods, makes them very strong and resistant. Come and take a look.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A new category This Navetta 73 by Absolute has a greater habitability than a boat this size can express! Also the interiors are very curated and charming, the fabrics chosen are amazing and the lines of the furniture are very nice, as all have been softened. VIP cabins are so nice and comfortable, which is something that is not frequently found. This marvel begins a new category of yachts.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: A vintage feel Segesta Yachting has made a very special yacht, the Capri 50. This marvel looks like an American fisherman but is fully Italian. With its soft and modern shapes, this is new boat that recalls the past, a look that is impossible to find in nowadays boats. This boat is handmade and no compromises have been made. Designed only for those who can afford a boat that belongs to the highest category.

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Luxury and technology Creating better products is as ongoing process, Ferretti is always seeking for more. The Ferretti 670 is surely a very success full offer just as the electronic equipment onboard… have you ever heard of mechatronics?

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: ZF Marine for Seven Marine The largest and most powerful outboard engine in the world is built by Seven Marine and for the transmission they turned to ZF Marine… Check out its performance!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Class and beauty Prepare to be amazed by the beauty and class of the Custom line Navetta 42. You will probably get distracted by the its look, but don’t forget that this super yacht is also very safe and comfortable!

programme.title: The Boat Show
programme.desc: Tradition and innovation The Azimut S6 is a beautiful yacht, with the interiors designed by Francesco Guida. Its materials are very innovative and they blend with the classical elements, resulting in perfect combination. But what about the technical qualities? You will not be disappointed! This boat is sporty, luxurious and very technological!

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
morgxn We were recently visited at the Baeble studios by alt-pop singer/songwriter morgxn, who had the chance to perform stripped down versions of some of his songs. Armed with just a piano, he let his voice shine, switching between powerhouse vocals and delicate vibrato.
He obviously has the talent, but dig a little deeper and you'll find that he has the heart to go with it. Each of his songs drips with emotion and meaning. 'Me without you,' one of the songs morgxn played for us during this session, is a sweet message to his late father. 'It took me a long time to find the words to say how much I missed him when I wrote that song I remember feeling like I had finally said what I was trying to say and it was almost like I had released that from my body,' said morgxn. 'Getting to revisit the song, it brings it back up. But that's like the gift of music, I get to carry him with me.'
He also performed 'Home,' a song that perfectly captures the joy of finding a place where you belong. Both songs can be found on morgxn's debut album, Vital, which was released May of this year. Vital, mixes soft synths and instruments to create a unique and catchy backdrop to his moving lyrics. Over the course of the album, morgxn strives to discover what parts of his life are vital to him and which are not. Through various impactful experiences in his life, he weaves together an honest representation of himself and creates a beautiful ode to individuality.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: A Baeble Next Session with Cyn Emerging star Cyn stopped by Baeble HQ for a session and conversation to celebrate the release of her EP 'Mood Swing.' She brought all her charm, talent and infectious laughs and the result was an intimate and fun look at her music and creative process.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: A Bands and Brews Session with The Lagoons California raised brothers Joey and Ryan Selan came East for a warm summer night concert in Brooklyn. They brought their breezy, bluesy vibe with them to fill the warm evening air. Sit back, sip a cocktail and let their tunes roll through your ears.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
Jack Savoretti Hi, my name is Jack Savoretti... What else would you like to know?' The UK singer-songwriter said as he let out a laugh when he stopped by the Baeble offices. Well, there were a couple of things we wanted to know: how he got into making music, the meaning behind his latest album Sleep No More, and of course, if he could play some stripped down songs for us. Savoretti started with 'Only You' and we were immediately head over heels in love with his raspy growl and understated charm. He continued with 'I'm Yours' and the first song he wrote for the album, 'When We Were Lovers.'
'It is about all the things that keep me up at night, and those are good things, bad things, and things that haven't even happened yet. I think those are the typical situations of most men and women my age,' the singer said when asked to explain the meaning behind the title of his album. 'It's a combination of the life I used to have... And now it's different to parenting, being a good husband, being a good man, working more, and trying to provide and be responsible. It's a combination of passion and responsibility and doing that, I found there's not much time for sleep.' That balance between being passionate and responsible is evident throughout his songs. There's so much passion and feeling in his performance and when you listen to the lyrics, you hear that he's singing about being faithful to the one he loves, 'Now I really get what love is for, it hit me at the stroke of midnight,' he sings in 'I'm Yours.' 'Only you is all I need, only you know where to go to get to me,' he loyally pledges once again in 'Only You.'
For anyone going through a new phase in life, for anyone who feels like it's time to grow up (and don't we all feel like that sometimes?), Savoretti's captivating lyricism and unique voice will stick with you for a while.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: TT Theresa Wayman - a vital slice of the indie rock band Warpaint - recently stepped into Baeble Music HQ for a solo Baeble NEXT Session. Wayman is a founder and 15 year veteran of the band. Her solo project, TT, is long overdue. When she sat down with us, the Oregon-native singer-songwriter revealed that she's been working on the project since she was 15 as a means to find herself. 'Within the band we don't really get to get everything outwe're all writing and there's only so much you can put on an album. Everybody's got more ideas that what we just bring to that project', TT explained in regard to her solo stint. TT brought flavors of love and heartbreak to Baeble, performing two songs from her debut solo record, LoveLaws, beginning with 'Love Leaks', followed by 'I've Been Fine'. We'd like to give a quick shout-out to whoever broke TT's heart, because without you these songs may not exist. Oh and don't worry, she's been fine. TT also slipped in a couple Warpaint tracks, including a super stripped down version of 'Love Is To Die' and 'So Good'. Every note sang was bursting with raw emotion, accompanied by a mix of piano and bass. So, if you want to know the real Theresa Wayman, without her Warpaint, check out her Baeble NEXT session.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Nicole Bus Fresh off the release of her debut album 'Kairos' out on Rocnation, Nicole came by the studio to strip down and perform a couple of songs off this fresh release. Nicole got her start on Dutch version of The Voice in her native Holland. She has been building on this since and is now poised to rise in the US.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
Chelsea Cutler If we believe what we've been told by every YA novel and rom-com to ever exist, summer means reckless adventures and dreamy teenage romance. Singer-songwriter Chelsea Cutler provides the perfect soundtrack for all your summertime festivities, whether you're road tripping to the beach or watching the sunset over the city skyline. Cutler's writing is effortless, and our exclusive session with the rising star proves she's one to keep a close eye on this year.
Considering how much raw talent she possesses, it's surprising to hear the 20-year-old admit she never intended to make a career out of playing music. Cutler learned guitar and piano when she was young and later, like so many hopeful independent artists, began posting covers on SoundCloud. After tackling the work of everyone from Odesza and the Chainsmokers to Jack Johnson and The Tallest Man on Earth in her repertoire, Cutler's own unique blend of electronic and acoustic sounds started to take shape.
We got to witness Cutler's brilliance during a stripped-back session at Baeble HQ this spring. Just her and a guitar, Cutler's delicate vocals filled the space with the confidence of a seasoned performer. Stepping out from the shadow of electronic production, Cutler gives her impressive lyrics a chance to breathe. If you're in the mood for some youthful summertime nostalgia, you won't want to miss this captivating performance.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
LP 'My first major label deal really got me started on the songwriting thing. In 2006 I was signed by Island Def Jam and they basically kept pushing me to write with all these big songwriters,' singer-songwriter LP told us when she stopped by the Baeble Studio a few weeks ago. We may be labeling her session as a Baeble NEXT, but LP has been around behind the scenes writing for other artists for forever. After getting signed and receiving a credit on a Backstreet Boys song, she realized she could actually do the whole songwriting thing. 'About three years on major labels - that yielded no fruit, no record came out - but I had written around 140 songs.' After then switching to a publishing deal and losing her 'passion for the passion' (songwriting), it wasn't until she bought a ukulele that the flame was rekindled.
LP is now back and writing her best music to date. Just last year, she followed up her 2014 album Forever For Now with her stunning sophomore album Lost On You. During our session she played its catchy title track and she had the Baeble staff both startled and amazed with her signature whistle. She is like, really good as whistling, you guys. Surrounded by a cajon player, a guitarist, and her infamous ukulele, she also performed 'Girls Go Wild.' Both songs showcased her knack for writing melodic choruses that are both beautiful and empowering. LP may be small, but she has a huge voice. You'll understand why we're so amazed by this singer when you watch the session for yourself.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
A Baeble Next Session with Robert DeLong When Robert Delong stepped into our studio, it was immediately clear that he wasnt interested in showing us anything that wed seen before. He brought with him mountains of equipment, which littered every surface of our office, and used them to set up a scene that was, just like his song, Revolutionary.
He roams from his complicated audio mixers to the electric guitar, looking equally at home behind both. Drum pads bridge the gap, and Delong pounds on them faster than a racing heartbeat, triumphantly dropping his drumstick after he nails each verse. Oh, and hes also belting out his lyrics the entire time. Hes doing _so much_ on stage, but hes not alone. Hes helped by his talented bassist, drummer, and thanks to the wonders of technology, K.Flay. During her collaboration with Delong, Favorite Color is Blue, she stares out at us from a flat screen, singing in between neon and psychedelic patterns.
Its so obviously appropriate that his newest EP (out today go check it out!) is called See You in The Future. Because Delong isnt interested in anything that isnt pushing forward. Youre either in the future or youre falling behind. So try and keep up!

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
Future Generations Earlier this summer, Future Generations swung by Industry City in Brooklyn to deliver a killer set at one of the latest Bands + Brews, presented by Baeble Music. As the sun settled into the skyline, the NYC-based quintet enhanced the warm August breeze with their soaring electric guitars and nostalgic vocals.
The indie rockers performed some new songs, like their latest single 'One More Problem' which was released just the month before via Frenchkiss Records. This moment really made us feel like we were at a stadium rather than an outdoor courtyard. Frontman Eddie Gore's pop-tinged vocal boasted similarities to MGMT or Foster The People, especially when paired with the band's psychedelia-flavored music. In addition to hearing a new single, the band also played a handful of cuts off of their self-titled 2016 album, like 'Rain,' 'Grace,' and 'Black & Bleu,' amongst others.
Already sick of the cold fall weather? Fear not, because our latest Bands + Brews concert with Future Generations is bound to warm you up.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Alt-J Live from the Vault Alt-J Brings their distinct style to the beauty of Red Rocks.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Alt-J Live from the Vault Alt-J Brings their distinct style to the beauty of Red Rocks.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
Bea Miller and NOTD Bea Miller and NOTD recently stopped into our studio to promote their new collab 'I Wanna Know.' With duo NOTD's producing chops and Bea's crystal clear voice, they make up a pop powerhouse that's taken the world (and the radio) by storm.
'I Wanna Know' started in the bedroom of Sam Brandt, one half of NOTD. He and Tobias Danielsson started the duo together and worked on songs as they attended high school (They're 17 and 19 years old, respectively). They're best known for their remixes of mega-stars like Ed Sheeran and Rihanna, but when they finished 'I Wanna Know,' they knew they had something special, so they sent it off to Bea Miller's management.
'I remember, within like 40 seconds or less I was like, 'Ok I need to get in the studio tomorrow and record this,' laughed Bea. And she's not the only one who liked it immediately- the song has spread like wildfire and has quickly become a contender for 'Song of the Summer.'
In the studio, the trio played an acoustic version of their hit, really letting the emotional lyrics shine. They also performed 'Like That,' Bea Miller's raw and honest song about being treated like crap and fighting to feel ok again.
It's rare to see so much young talent in a room, and we can't wait to see what the future holds for Bea and NOTD. It's sure to be bright.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Regina Spektor Live from London Regina Spektor's 'Live in London' is a romp through the London night.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
A Baeble Next Session With Brynn Elliott When Brynn Elliott mentions that she went to Harvard, it doesnt register as a surprise. As she shifts around on her stool, musing about the relationship between philosophy and pop music and about finding her feminist strength with the help of 15th century female philosophers, she oozes intelligence and thoughtfulness.
This isnt to say that her music is in any way pretentious. She creates anthems that are universal, at once personal and relatable. Her lyrics are straightforward and her meaning is always clear. Opening up into the chorus of her first song, Might Not Like Me, she sings Well if you dont like girls that are stronger than you than you might not like me. Not a lot of room for misinterpretation.
She moves on to reflect on social media and internet presence. Can I run away with the internet you? she croons in her song Internet You. She finishes with her airy and elated song Time of Our Lives. Each song offers a glimpse into a different phase in her life. Listening to her set, its almost like youve sneaked a look into her diary.
Well, I have to say, that would be the most eloquent, poetic, and enchanting diary ever written.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
Mako I've found that if you ask people what type of music they listen to, most will say that they listen to a bit of everything (except for country, of course). Yet this is rarely true- people tend to have a much narrower taste than they realize. Which is why it's so refreshing to find someone who has a true appreciation for the entire spectrum of genres. Alex Seaver is one of those people. Although best known for his DJ performances under the name Mako, Seaver got his start as a classical musician. That jump may seem extreme, but Seaver says that it felt completely natural. Many of his first favorite electronic artists, such as Swedish House Mafia and Above and Beyond, played with big, beautiful sounds that aimed to draw the same emotions as soaring symphonies. Seaver appreciated the shared beauty of the music but was drawn to the youthful and wild atmosphere of the electronic shows.
'When you create a lot you can't really choose what you're going to fall in love with, it just kind of happens, and for some reason that stuff clicked really quickly for me.'
So Mako was born, the brainchild of Seaver and his close friend Logan Light. Mako very quickly made a name for itself with its upbeat dance tracks like 'Smoke Filled Room,' which reached 23 million plays on Spotify and 'Beam,' which has surpassed 25 million streams online. The act continues to evolve as it looks towards the future, and this last year and a half has been especially full of changes as Logan Light moved on to different things and left Seaver as a solo act.
In its newest incarnation, Mako is looking to bridge the gap between electronic and live music, and is adding a violinist, a drummer, and a guitarist to supplement Seaver's sound. Seaver hopes that his new approach will help him connect to the audience in a stronger way, and so far it seems to be working. 'This is the first time where it's like, I wrote a song in Los Angeles about something from my life and then I go to a city I've never been to and everyone is singing the song with me in the room. That just changed the game for me.'
Follow Seaver's journey towards authenticity and connection with our latest NEXT Session.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: lovelytheband lovelytheband joined us in the studio, stripped their songs down and goofed around a little for us in this exclusive Baeble session.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
Overcoats If you still don't know, Overcoats is a New York-based duo that consists of Hana Elion and JJ Mitchell. Their harmonies blend together to make indie electro-pop music that not only sounds pretty on the surface, but permeates a true sense of self-empowerment. Earlier this summer, the duo made a stop at Industry City for a Bands + Brews session, presented by Baeble Music.
The two performed songs off of their debut album YOUNG. Before going into the first song, 'Smaller Than My Mother,' the two shared a hug, as if this was the last performance of their entire career -- or they were just really happy to be there. Probably the latter. Elion was in a white dress while Mitchell wore black, and, with no other members but themselves, the performance as a whole was minimalistic, which put their nearly perfect vocals on display. As they dove into 'Hold Me Close,' the two broke out into an endearing little dance - something they peppered throughout their performance - not choreographed, but in unison.
'The Fog' was a bit of a darker cut. Right before Mitchell called out 'the future is female!', the two sang, 'freedom is when I'm without you / when the fog lifts, I'm the only one I see.' Siren-like synths screech, and as they sing those lines, something about it just feels so damn good. It's one thing to preach about being independent, but it's an entirely different thing to show it. Here were two legitimate best friends right before us -- two women who were friends before they were musical partners, and as they sang about not needing a man to feel complete, they truly proved that as they cheered each other on. Through the relationship of two best friends, we were exploring the journey through womanhood.
Sure, Overcoats' voices are sweet and their beats are sultry, but on the night of Bands + Brews, they brought something much bigger to Baeble. They proved that it is possible to lift each other up. Experience the positive vibes in full, with our newest Bands + Brews.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Linkin Park Road To Revolution Linkin Park bring their Projekt Revolution Tour to the National Bowl in Milton Keynes.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
SYML 'My wife actually helped me pick it out... She knew that I was adopted and didn't find out until much later in life that I was a majority Welsh by blood, and so she was looking for cool Welsh words. It's a Welsh word that means 'simple.' She knows that that's something I strive for in most things in my life,' vocalist Brian Fennell answered when we asked him the first question on everyone's minds. Back in the day Fennell was a part of Barcelona, who helped to create staggering and cinematic soundscapes reminiscent of an early-years Coldplay. In fact, we caught them a couple years back during a packed and sweaty performance at Spike Hill. These days Fennell is still tickling the ebonies and ivories, but now under his moody and gripping new solo project SYML.
We caught up with SYML recently, both to recollect some old memories and to create some new ones. Brian hasn't missed a beat since branching out on his own, and SYML picks up right where he left off. In our exclusive Baeble NEXT Session with him you'll get the chance to hear all about what Brian has been up to since starting his new project, as well as a peek behind the curtains about what goes into writing his devastatingly powerful and touching tunes.
Of course you'll also get the chance to hear those tunes, as SYML absolutely crushes it in our studio with his enrapturing vocal presence and unparalleled skill as a multi-instrumentalist.
Most importantly though, in addition to now knowing the meaning behind it, you'll also get the chance to learn how to pronounce SYML!

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
A Baeble Next Session with Lauv When one of Lauv's songs comes on the radio, it can too easily be dismissed. The cotton-candy electronic sounds flow so well that it's hard to really pay attention to them, to listen to the intricacies in the notes. But when Lauv takes his place behind a piano, it's impossible not to stop and listen. Even with everything electronic or superfluous stripped from away, he still seems to fill up every inch of space in the room. It's hard to believe that he's armed only with one piano and one voice, especially as his voice effortlessly dances between octaves.
He starts singing his hit song 'I Like Me Better' in a low and pensive tone, and builds, singing higher and higher until the song ends. He sings his other two songs 'The Other' and 'Bracelet' with equal intensity. His brow stays furrowed and his eyes half closed as he sits at the piano.
Lauv is, at his heart, a singer-songwriter, a self-proclaimed 'guy with a laptop,' and his writing is deeply personal and gorgeously lyrical, something that's not exactly common for electronic producers. It makes his intensity come off as perfectly genuine rather than overly theatrical. It's captivating enough to make you really listen- not just to this performance, but to every time that Lauv comes on in the future.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Tegan and Sara - Docs and Concert A special triple combination of Tegan and Sara. 'States', 'India' and 'For The Most Part.'

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
SHAED - Bands and Brews Get pumped for a dynamic Baeble Bands + Brews session from SHAED. The electro-pop trio beamed with an energetic set, where they performed songs including 'Too Much,' 'Just Wanna See,' and 'Lonesome.' Chelsea Lee leads with her powerhouse vocals, while twin brothers Max and Spencer Ernst provide snappy production and backup vocals.
Their performance was filled with shades (or should I say SHAEDS) of color, as amplifying blue/red lights seamlessly synchronized with their vibrant music. Their effervescent presence and multi-layered live renditions of songs made for an exciting show. They performed songs off their EP Just Wanna See, as well as singles including 'Lonesome,' released this past October. Speaking about the song, Chelsea said 'It touches on different kinds of relationships and we didn't want to be stuck talking about one kind of relationship within the song.' Combining sentimental elements with an expansive vigor, the song feels full of different dimensions.
The band is also embarking on tour tomorrow, starting in Chicago and ending in their hometown, Washington, D.C. See dates below and stay tuned for the full Bands + Brews session.
SHAED On Tour:
11/30 - Beat Kitchen - Chicago, IL
12/2 - Drake - Toronto, Canada
12/4 - Great Scott - Allston, MA
12/5 - Public Arts - New York, NY
12/7 - Johnny Brenda's - Philadelphia, PA
12/8 - Rock & Roll Hotel - Washington, DC

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Grouplove I'm With You Grouplove chronicles their creation and distinctive sound with the documentary 'I'm With You.'

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
The Wonder Years This just in! The guitar is NOT dead. It's not even ailing...just ask The Wonder Years. Well, actually, just watch this session and they'll tell you. The melodic, punk outfit from Pennsylvania stopped by Baeble recently for a little change of pace, performing three acoustic tracks with - GASP! - three guitars.
A band that once started out as a now credits 6 full-length albums, two EPs, and 13 strong years of jamming out to thousands and thousands of people to their name. Oh, and don't forget about this beautiful Baeble NEXT session. Led by Dan 'Soupy' Campbell, the band brought poppy, punk goodness of course, but they also brought the stories behind the three songs offered here. And we love a good story. Campbell told us of the bands heartening experience in Chile that lead to the name of their album and title track, Sister Cities.
The Wonder Years probably can't be summed up any better than what Hanif Abdurraquib wrote in their bio for the new album: 'They play rock and roll and they play it like they mean it'. If you're not quite sure how to conceptualize that statement, Campbell put it like this...nerve damage. When they perform, they go hard...like, they put their whole bodies into it. Kind of like football players. And when they play that hard night in and night out, sometimes it results in a little nerve damage...but you'll have to watch the session for more details. The band started with 'Pyramids of Salt', followed by 'Cardinals', and concluded the session with 'Sister Cities', the title track from their latest album.
Click the image below for amazing session photos:

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc: Salt Cathedral The magic of Salt Cathedral is the obvious joy that they perform with, which stems from the music but also from their friendship. 'We hang out, we have fun the music is just a byproduct of that,' remarked Nicolas. It means that there's a sense of intimacy to the music, even as it continues to lend itself to something larger than all of us.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
A Bands and Brews Session with Jukebox The Ghost 'Everyone is boring,' sings Jukebox the Ghost. 'Everyone is lame.' And as much as we all don't want to admit it, that's often the case. So, in order to break up the monotony of your existence, Baeble is delighted to bring you this special session at Industry City.
Jukebox the Ghost had a lot to celebrate with this session, recorded a day before the release of their newest album, Off to the Races. They started their set off with an old favorite, 'Somebody,' before treating their audience to some acoustic versions of their newest songs, 'Boring,' 'Jumpstarted,' 'People Go Home,' 'Everybody's Lonely,' and 'Fred Astaire.'
Although it continues to push their sound in a forward direction, this new album stays true to their sound that they've been developing for a decade. They've perfected their combination of warm sounds and honest, biographical lyrics. The resulting feel-good songs have earned them a small but dedicated legion of fans. The fact is, if you don't know who Jukebox the Ghost is, you're out of the loop.
So, whether (like the live audience of this session) you need something to warm you on a snowy night, or you just need something to cheer you up when you've had a bad day, you can rely on Ben, Tommy and Jesse for songs that will bring a smile to your face.

programme.title: Baeble Concerts
programme.desc:
